text: I was in Africa correspondent with the
agus Africa News Service I spent a lot
of my time in Rhodesia covering the
political story I got to know a lot of
the black nationalist leaders including
Robert Mugabe who then became a very
good friend this country is in a state
of shock tonight Rhodesians were
prepared when they woke up this morning
to hear that Robert Mugabe had won the
most seats all over the country they
huddled in groups listening to the radio
and when the official announcement was
finally made they went wild throughout
the day they've been singing and dancing
I was with him when the results of the
1980 elections were announced and he
jumped up and said yes you know now you
know he was excited we were all excited
we're hugging well I think I had heard
the news earlier and it says so my heart
went back hanging back agadez who enjoy
growing up in Rhodesia where there was
racial discrimination oh that was good
to be behind us us now you know a
first-class citizen in my own country he
still regarded as the father figure you
know as a revolutionary who brought
about an end to the Rhodesians
oppressive system
it was different from all the other
politicians you know he was a true
Democrat I wish to assure you that there
can never be any return to the state of
armed conflict which existed before our
commitment to peace he used to come and
visit me at my house we used to listen
to music we listened to Jim Reeves and
sometimes we say the long Brahma Jack -
a key with no regrets I stacked the
cards last night I was really close I
was part of the inner group but then I
started questioning you know you know
what I was being told government troops
have been accused of indiscriminate
murders in their search for dissidents
opposed to mr. micawber's government in
some places local people have managed to
bury their own dead the death toll could
reach a thousand or more we'll probably
never know for sure because the
government denies the atrocities
I would tell him what was you know what
I what I knew what I'd heard and he
would come back with video his side of
the story in such an articulate person
is actually an intelligent person and to
imagine him as a thug you know I really
could not get that dinner into my head
did I want to remain part of this system
it took a while for me to make up my
mind to leave my job and set up an
independent daily which then published
the daily news it's the reporting of the
role of the police that's led to the
arrest of four journalists including the
editor from the Daily News an
independent newspaper does being
harassed my telephone was bugged I was
followed everywhere I went after I've
had you know developed a relationship
with the person that you regard him as a
friend he does hurt I'm glad we had the
relationship I'm glad I got to know him
well at a time when he really cared
about the country when he really cared
about the people
